name: dbux-code
description: Integrated Debugging Environment with an Omniscient Debugger for JS.

commands.title: Dbux: Toggle Editor Navigation Bar Buttons
Dbux: Open PDG for Selected Function
Document changed -> code decorations might be inaccurate
Dbux: Go to previous "non-trivial" trace in context
Dbux: Go to previous function call in context
Dbux: Go to start of context
Dbux: Go to next "non-trivial" trace in context
Dbux: Go to next function call in context
Dbux: Go to end of context
Dbux: Go to previous execution of the same trace
Dbux: Go to next execution of the same trace
Dbux Dev: Delete all user events
Dbux Project: Run without dbux in debug mode
Dbux Project: Run with dbux in debug mode

dbux.autoStart.description: Whether to auto-start Dbux when opening vscode. Else, you have to click the "Start Dbux" button manually every time. (During this early stage, we still hide Dbux default behavior behind a button, to make sure you don't see annoying messages pop up when Dbux has to update dependencies etc. We will improve upon that as Dbux evolves.)

dbux.paths.git.description: When executing git terminal commands, use `git` from this path. Only used for auto-installing and managing practice projects.

dbux.paths.node.description: When executing terminal commands, use `node` from this path. (Hint: If you change this, you probably also want to change `paths.npm`.)

dbux.paths.npm.description: When installing packages initially or practice projects, use `npm` from this path. (Hint: If you change this, you probably also want to change `paths.node`.)

dbux.paths.yarn.description: When playing with practice projects that require `yarn`, use this path. (Hint: If you change this, you probably also want to change `paths.npm`.)

dbux.paths.windows.shell.description: When executing terminal or system commands, use this shell.

dbux.paths.posix.shell.description: When executing terminal or system commands, use this shell.

dbux.shells.bash.inlineFlags.description: Args required to run an inline command with bash. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20858381/what-does-bash-c-do

dbux.shells.bash.pause.default: read -p "(Done. Press any key to exit.)"

dbux.shells.cmd.inlineFlags.description: Args required to run an inline command with cmd. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9392874/bat-file-open-new-cmd-window-and-execute-a-command-in-there

dbux.run.dbuxArgs.description: Custom `dbux run` command options. You can find a list of all available dbux command options in https://github.com/Domiii/dbux/blob/master/dbux-cli/src/commandCommons.js

dbux.run.nodeArgs.description: Custom node options passed to node when running the program.

dbux.run.programArgs.description: Custom program arguments, available to the program via `process.argv`.

dbux.run.env.description: Custom program environment variables available via `process.env` (probably not working yet).

dbux.debug.dbuxArgs.description: Custom `dbux run` command options. You can find a list of all available dbux command options in https://github.com/Domiii/dbux/blob/master/dbux-cli/src/commandCommons.js

dbux.debug.nodeArgs.description: Custom node options passed to node when running the program.

dbux.debug.programArgs.description: Custom program arguments, available to the program via `process.argv`.

dbux.debug.env.description: Custom program environment variables available via `process.env` (probably not working yet).

dbux.packageWhitelist.description: Specify which package will be traced by Dbux, seperated by space, regex supported.

scripts.package-no-build: rm -rf *.vsix && yarn update-docs && echo 'Packaging...' && vsce package --yarn --baseImagesUrl https://github.com/Domiii/dbux/dbux-code --baseContentUrl https://github.com/Domiii/dbux/dbux-code
scripts.package:pkg+analyze: yarn package-no-build && mkdir _analysis && mv *.vsix _analysis && cd _analysis && 7z x -o"contents" *.vsix
